context:
Title: Effects of Metformin and Lifestyle Modification on Glycemic Control in Adults with Type 2 Diabetes: A Randomized Controlled Trial

Abstract: This randomized controlled trial evaluated the efficacy of metformin combined with lifestyle modification in improving glycemic control among adults aged 45-65 with newly diagnosed Type 2 Diabetes. A total of 240 participants were randomly assigned to receive either metformin (1000mg twice daily) plus a structured exercise program and dietary counseling, or standard care alone. The primary outcome was change in HbA1c levels from baseline to 6 months. Secondary outcomes included fasting blood glucose, body weight, and quality of life scores. Results showed a significant reduction in HbA1c levels in the intervention group (mean decrease of 1.8%) compared to the control group (mean decrease of 0.5%, p<0.001). The intervention was well-tolerated with minimal adverse events. These findings suggest that combining metformin with lifestyle modification is an effective and safe approach for managing Type 2 Diabetes in middle-aged adults.
prompt_description:
Extract Disease, Intervention, Population, Outcome, Finding in order of appearance.
Use exact text for extractions. Do not paraphrase or overlap entities.
Provide meaningful attributes for each entity to add context.

entities.name: Disease
entities.description: The medical condition or disease being studied

entities.name: Intervention
entities.description: The treatment, drug, or procedure being tested or evaluated

entities.name: Population
entities.description: The characteristics of the study population

entities.name: Outcome
entities.description: The measured outcomes or endpoints of the study

entities.name: Finding
entities.description: The main findings or results of the study
